meanings.definition: The quality of being open to more than one interpretation.
meanings.sent1: The ambiguity in her statement left everyone confused.
meanings.sent2: The ambiguity of the instructions made it hard to know what to do.
meanings.sent3: The ambiguity in the joke made it even funnier.
meanings.sent4: The ambiguity of his smile hinted at hidden emotions.
meanings.sent5: The ambiguity of the painting sparked endless debates.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's ambiguity in grading made students anxious.
meanings.sent2: The ambiguity of the weather forecast led to confusion.
meanings.sent3: The ambiguity in the riddle made it challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: The ambiguity of her answer left him puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The ambiguity of the map caused them to take the wrong turn.

meanings.definition: A lack of decisiveness or commitment resulting from a failure to make a choice between alternatives.
meanings.sent1: His ambiguity in decision-making often led to delays.
meanings.sent2: The manager's ambiguity in strategy caused inefficiency.
meanings.sent3: The ambiguity in his excuse made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent4: The ambiguity of his position left his team uncertain.
meanings.sent5: The ambiguity of her stance created confusion among the group.
